course_description: This course will survey the use of forensic evidence, focusing on the intersection of legal frameworks and scientific reliability, the significance of cognitive bias, racial justice, and constitutional rights. Students will also learn to compare the different forms of forensic evidence and contemplate ways to strengthen the use of science and protect against the misuse of science and surveillance in the criminal legal system. At the center of these considerations will be the human beings whose lives are directly impacted.
sections: Class Nbr: 5597, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 6:30-9:30p, Instructor: E. Prokesch, Status: Open
